css.questionText: The property in CSS used to change the background color of an element is :
css.explanation: The background-color property is used to specify the background color of an element.

css.questionText: The CSS property used to control the element's font-size is -
css.explanation: The font-size property in CSS is used to specify the height and size of the font.

css.questionText: Which of the following is the correct syntax to make the background-color of all paragraph elements to yellow?
css.explanation: The background-color property in CSS is used to change the background color of an element. The correct syntax to make the background color of all paragraph elements to yellow is: p {background-color : yellow;}.

css.questionText: The CSS property used to make the text bold is -
css.explanation: The font-weight property is used for setting the thickness and boldness of the font. It is used to define the weight of the text. The available weight depends on the font-family, which is used by the browser.

css.questionText: Are the negative values allowed in padding property?
css.explanation: The negative values are not allowed when using the padding property.

css.questionText: The CSS property used to specify the transparency of an element is -
css.explanation: The CSS opacity property is used to specify the transparency of an element. In simple words, you can say that it specifies the clarity of the image.

css.questionText: Which of the following CSS property is used to specify the space between every letter inside an element?
css.explanation: The letter-spacing property in CSS is used to control the space between every letter inside an element or the block of text.

css.questionText: Which of the following syntax is correct in CSS to make each word of a sentence start with a capital letter?
css.explanation: The text-transform CSS property allows us to change the case of the text. It is used to control text capitalization.
